segments.text: I notice the boy is really determined to get those cookies, standing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretching so far, I think he's going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting patiently for her cookie, her hand outstretched.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they know they're making a mess behind the woman's back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, creating a puddle that's getting bigger and bigger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to have a big cleanup on her hands soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it's about to tip over any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around soon before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I'm watching a scene from a comedy show.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is just hilarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but laugh at the absurdity of it all.
segments.speaker: PAR
